predicate.note: Frames file for 'repatriate' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry.

roleset.name: send one back to one's homeland

example.name: not really repatriate
example.text: Sheraton and Pan Am said they are assured under the Soviet joint-venture law that they can repatriate profits from their hotel venture.

example.name: clearer example
example.text: China had refused [*-2] to repatriate citizens who sneaked into Hong Kong illegally since early this month, when the colony allowed a dissident Chinese swimmer to flee to the U.S.
example.arg: citizens who sneaked into Hong Kong illegally

example.name: with homeland
example.text: John was repatriated *trace* to Lower Slobovia.
